basics.name: Louie Bala
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science in the Department of Information and Computer Sciences at the University of Hawaii. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2024.

education.institution: Pearl City High School, Pearl City, HI

highlights: Design and develop responsive and dynamic websites using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
Utilize frameworks and libraries such as React and Angular to build interactive website.
Collaborate within a team to gather requirements, troubleshoot issues, and deploy web projects to production environments.
Prepared materials to facilitate the crafting of consumer products
Assisted in setting up and dismantling booth displays for craft fairs
Provided customer service and support during craft fairs
Collaborated with a relative to gain hands-on trade experience
Demonstrated rapid proficiency in operating a diverse range of tools
Gained a deep understanding of the physical demands inherent in the trade industry.
Assisting head instructor by helping warm-up the class
Teaching individuals and group of students
Simultaneously, activiely engaged in my own training and offer assistance to fellow classmates
An ACM Manoa special interest group focused on studying and applying algorithms
Their mission is to foster algorithmic problem-solving skills vital for success in computer science
There are weekly meetings to tackle algorithm problems, mirroring those found in technical job interviews
Former member of the JIKC competition team, competing in Hawaii tournaments

awards.title: High-School National Spanish Exam Participant
awards.awarder: the American Association of Teachers of Spanish and Portuguese
awards.summary: Invited and Participated all 4 years of high school to take the exam

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.summary: Undergraduate students are awarded the Dean's List distinction if they: (1) earn a semester grade point average of 3.5 or higher based on 12 credits or more taken for a grade (C/NC courses do not count), and (2) do not receive grades of W, I, F, or NC for that semester.

awards.title: Manoa Academic Merit Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarship is an automatic $2,000 scholarship per year for four years of undergraduate study for first-time degree seeking students. Students must have a 3.5 GPA, 1200 SAT or 23 ACT upon the time of application to UH Manoa.

awards.title: B+ Scholarship
awards.summary: Scholarships awarded to incoming freshmen and continuing students who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.0 at a Hawai'i public school.

awards.title: 2021 UH Manoa Summer First-Year Merit Scholarship
awards.awarder: University of Hawai'i Manoa Outreach College
awards.summary: University of Hawaiʻi at Mānoa Outreach College is pleased to offer a $1,200 merit scholarship to up to 100 first-year UH Mānoa students for Summer Sessions 2021. This award recognizes academically exceptional students who have demonstrated a commitment to completing their UH Mānoa degree in four years.
